intro: Polygala comosa subsp. alibotuschiense, commonly known as the Alibotuschiense milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in East Asia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, and the flowers are often pale yellow or greenish in color. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
